taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;subfamily amygdaloideae;tribe spiraeeae;genus aruncus;species dioicus;variety dioicus

bio:treatment.description: Leaf surfaces glabrous or slightly hairy. Styles 0.3–0.8 mm. Follicles somewhat plump, 1.5–2 mm. Seeds 1.5–2 mm. 2n = 18.
Rich woods, stream banks, north-facing roadsides, seeps, ditches;
Ala., Ga., Ky., Md., Miss., N.C., Ohio, Pa., S.C., Tenn., Va., W.Va.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety dioicus is abundant in the southern Appalachians and into the Piedmont, where it typically occurs on mesic north-facing wooded slopes and road sides.
